content: @simulacrum https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-perf/pull/1137 added a new profiler but didn't update the README. Is this intentional?
rustc-perf doesn't require r+ before merging, I think? I wonder if that should be changed...
Not today, no -- I'm not sure we have enough review bandwidth on it to make that worthwhile, but I'd not generally be opposed.
I have review bandwidth for it, if necessary.
Code review is such a good thing... I'm reminded of the saying "if you can't afford travel insurance, you can't afford to travel".
I suspect there is (or should be) a similar saying that starts "if you can't afford code review..."

Yeah, I think establishing code review practices seems like a good idea, just need to get people on board... sounds like you have the bandwidth, though, so that's probably a great first step, at least.
I'd also like to make myself more available for review than I was at the end of last year.
If we can get 3 people to dedicate time to not have any PRs sit without any review, it would be nice to switch to r+ gating
r+ gating might help with keeping the docs up to date. E.g. diff_local isn't documented in the README, nor is the use of + prefixes to specify toolchains
